result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerad M Hitchcock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees (including DNA) by March 16, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerad M Hitchcock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  State complied with victim notification.   Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 48 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees (including DNA) by March 16, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Gerad M Hitchcock in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Gerad M Hitchcock in custody produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Gerad M Hitchcock in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Gerad M Hitchcock not in court, in custody not produced (House of Corrections).  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on and Speedy Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Gerad M Hitchcock not in court, in custody not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.    Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $75.00.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JERRY J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerad M Hitchcock in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Gerad M Hitchcock in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
